title: Cook the Book: Lentils with Pancetta
summary: Cook the Book: Lentils with Pancettan is a gluten free and dairy free recipe with 6 servings. One serving contains 230 calories, 12g of protein, and 9g of fat. For 67 cents per serving, this recipe covers 15% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 45 minutes. 1 person found this recipe to be tasty and satisfying. Head to the store and pick up pancetta, lentils, olive oil, and a few other things to make it today. With a spoonacular score of 54%, this dish is solid. Try Cook the Book: Barbecued Lentils, Cook the Book: Lentils with Roasted Beets, and Cook the Book: Basic French Lentils for similar recipes.
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Put the lentils in a medium pot, add water to cover by two inches, and bring to a simmer.  Add the vegetables, mustard, and pancetta, reduce the heat, and simmer gently until the lentils are just tender, about 20 minutes.  Drain, reserving 1/4 cup of the cooking liquid, and transfer to a large bowl.                                                                                                                            2                                                                            Remove the vegetables and pancetta from the lentils; discard the vegetables.  Coarsely chop the pancetta and add to the lentils.  Add just enough of the reserved cooking liquid to moisten the lentils, then add the oil and season with salt and pepper.  Serve, or let stand at room temperature for 1 hour to bring out the flavors.  (The lentils can be refrigerated for up to 3 days; bring to room temperature before serving.)

steps.step: Put the lentils in a medium pot, add water to cover by two inches, and bring to a simmer.
Add the vegetables, mustard, and pancetta, reduce the heat, and simmer gently until the lentils are just tender, about 20 minutes.
Drain, reserving 1/4 cup of the cooking liquid, and transfer to a large bowl.
Remove the vegetables and pancetta from the lentils; discard the vegetables.  Coarsely chop the pancetta and add to the lentils.
Add just enough of the reserved cooking liquid to moisten the lentils, then add the oil and season with salt and pepper.
Serve, or let stand at room temperature for 1 hour to bring out the flavors.  (The lentils can be refrigerated for up to 3 days; bring to room temperature before serving.)
